intro: Octarrhena cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that are typically heart-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Octarrhena cordata is adapted to arid environments and has a low water requirement, making it resilient in dry conditions.
